para: This chapter introduces you to shell expansion by taking a close look to commands and arguments. Knowing shell expansion is important because many commands on your Linux system are processed and most likely changed by the shell before they are executed.

The command line interface or shell used on most Linux systems is called bash/bin/bash, which stands for Bourne again shellBourne again shell. The bash shell incorporates features from sh/bin/sh (the original Bourne shell), csh/bin/csh (the C shell), and ksh/bin/ksh (the Korn shell).
